verses.verse: Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> visited <S%H6485><s%> Sarah <S%H8283><s%> as he had said, <S%H559><s%> and Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to Sarah <S%H8283><s%> as he had spoken. <S%H1696><s%>

Sarah <S%H8283><s%> conceived, <S%H2029><s%> and bore <S%H3205><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> a son <S%H1121><s%> in his old age, <S%H2208><s%> at the set time <S%H4150><s%> of which God <S%H430><s%> had spoken to him. <S%H1696><s%>
Abraham <S%H85><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> his <S%H8034><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> who was born <S%H3205><s%> to him, <S%H8283><s%> whom Sarah bore <S%H3205><s%> to him, <S%H3327><s%> Isaac.

Abraham <S%H85><s%> circumcised <S%H4135><s%> his son, <S%H1121><s%> Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> when he was eight <S%H8083><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> old, <S%H1121><s%> as God <S%H430><s%> had commanded him. <S%H6680><s%>
Abraham <S%H85><s%> was one hundred <S%H3967><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when his son, <S%H1121><s%> Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> was born to him. <S%H3205><s%>
Sarah <S%H8283><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "God <S%H430><s%> has made <S%H6213><s%> me laugh. <S%H6712><s%> Everyone who hears <S%H8085><s%> will laugh with me. <S%H6711><s%>"

She said, <S%H4448><s%> "Who would have said <S%H4448><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> that Sarah <S%H8283><s%> would nurse <S%H3243><s%> children? <S%H1121><s%> For I have borne <S%H3205><s%> him a son <S%H1121><s%> in his old age. <S%H2208><s%>"

The child <S%H3206><s%> grew, <S%H1431><s%> and was weaned. <S%H1580><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> feast <S%H4960><s%> on the day <S%H3117><s%> that Isaac <S%H3327><s%> was weaned. <S%H1580><s%>
Sarah <S%H8283><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Hagar <S%H1904><s%> the Egyptian, <S%H4713><s%> whom she had borne <S%H3205><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> mocking. <S%H6711><s%>

Therefore she said <S%H559><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> "Cast out <S%H1644><s%> this handmaid <S%H519><s%> and her son! <S%H1121><s%> For the son <S%H1121><s%> of this handmaid <S%H519><s%> will not be heir <S%H3423><s%> with my son, <S%H1121><s%> Isaac. <S%H3327><s%>"
The thing <S%H1697><s%> was very <S%H3966><s%> grievous <S%H3415><s%> in Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s sight <S%H5869><s%> on account <S%H182><s%> of his son. <S%H1121><s%>

God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> "Don't <S%H3415><s%> let it be grievous in your sight <S%H5869><s%> because of the boy, <S%H5288><s%> and because of your handmaid. <S%H519><s%> In all that Sarah <S%H8283><s%> says <S%H559><s%> to you, <S%H8085><s%> listen to her voice. <S%H6963><s%> For from Isaac <S%H3327><s%> will your seed <S%H2233><s%> be called. <S%H7121><s%>
I will also make <S%H7760><s%> a nation <S%H1471><s%> of the son <S%H1121><s%> of the handmaid, <S%H519><s%> because he is your seed. <S%H2233><s%>"

Abraham <S%H85><s%> rose up early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> and a bottle <S%H2573><s%> of water, <S%H4325><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> it to Hagar, <S%H1904><s%> putting <S%H7760><s%> it on her shoulder; <S%H7926><s%> and gave her the child, <S%H3206><s%> and sent her away. <S%H7971><s%> She departed, <S%H3212><s%> and wandered <S%H8582><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Beersheba. <S%H884><s%>
The water <S%H4325><s%> in <S%H4480><s%> the bottle <S%H2573><s%> was spent, <S%H3615><s%> and she cast <S%H7993><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> under one <S%H259><s%> of the shrubs. <S%H7880><s%>

She went <S%H3212><s%> and sat down <S%H3427><s%> opposite <S%H5048><s%> him, <S%H7368><s%> a good way off, about a bow shot <S%H2909><s%> away. <S%H559><s%> For she said, "Don't <S%H7200><s%> let me see the death <S%H4194><s%> of the child. <S%H3206><s%>" She sat <S%H3427><s%> over against him, <S%H5375><s%> and lifted up her voice, <S%H6963><s%> and wept. <S%H1058><s%>

God <S%H430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the boy. <S%H5288><s%> The angel <S%H4397><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> to Hagar <S%H1904><s%> out of the sky, <S%H8064><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H1904><s%> "What ails you, Hagar? Don't <S%H1904><s%> be afraid. For God <S%H430><s%> has heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the boy where he is. <S%H5288><s%>

Get up, <S%H5375><s%> lift up <S%H5375><s%> the boy, <S%H5288><s%> and hold <S%H2388><s%> him in your hand. <S%H3027><s%> For I will make <S%H7760><s%> him a great <S%H1419><s%> nation. <S%H1471><s%>"

God <S%H430><s%> opened <S%H6491><s%> her eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and she saw <S%H7200><s%> a well <S%H875><s%> of water. <S%H4325><s%> She went, <S%H3212><s%> filled <S%H4390><s%> the bottle <S%H2573><s%> with water, <S%H4325><s%> and gave <S%H8248><s%> the boy <S%H5288><s%> drink. <S%H8248><s%>
God <S%H430><s%> was with the boy, <S%H5288><s%> and he grew. <S%H1431><s%> He lived <S%H3427><s%> in the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> and became, <S%H7235><s%> as he grew up, an archer.

He lived <S%H3427><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Paran. <S%H6290><s%> His mother <S%H517><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%> for him out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

It happened at that time, <S%H6256><s%> that Abimelech <S%H40><s%> and Phicol <S%H6369><s%> the captain <S%H8269><s%> of his army <S%H6635><s%> spoke <S%H559><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "God <S%H430><s%> is with you in all that you do. <S%H6213><s%>

Now, <S%H7650><s%> therefore, swear to me here <S%H2008><s%> by God <S%H430><s%> that you will not deal falsely <S%H8266><s%> with me, <S%H5209><s%> nor with my son, nor with my son <S%H5220><s%>'s son. But according to the kindness <S%H2617><s%> that I have done <S%H6213><s%> to you, <S%H6213><s%> you shall do to me, <S%H776><s%> and to the land in which you have lived as a foreigner. <S%H1481><s%>"
Abraham <S%H85><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "I will swear. <S%H7650><s%>"

Abraham <S%H85><s%> complained <S%H3198><s%> to Abimelech <S%H40><s%> because <S%H182><s%> of a water <S%H4325><s%> well, <S%H875><s%> which Abimelech <S%H40><s%>'s servants <S%H5650><s%> had violently taken away. <S%H1497><s%>

Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "I don't <S%H3045><s%> know who has done <S%H6213><s%> this thing. <S%H1697><s%> You didn't <S%H3808><s%> tell <S%H5046><s%> me, <S%H3808><s%> neither did I hear <S%H8085><s%> of it, <S%H1115><s%> until today. <S%H3117><s%>"

Abraham <S%H85><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> and cattle, <S%H1241><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> them to Abimelech. <S%H40><s%> Those <S%H8147><s%> two made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant. <S%H1285><s%>
Abraham <S%H85><s%> set <S%H5324><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> ewe lambs <S%H3535><s%> of the flock by themselves. <S%H6629><s%>
Abimelech <S%H40><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> "What <S%H2008><s%> do these seven <S%H7651><s%> ewe lambs <S%H3535><s%> which you have set by themselves mean? <S%H5324><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "You shall take <S%H3947><s%> these seven <S%H7651><s%> ewe lambs <S%H3535><s%> from my hand, <S%H3027><s%> that <S%H5668><s%> it may be a witness <S%H5713><s%> to me, <S%H2658><s%> that I have dug this well. <S%H875><s%>"
Therefore he called <S%H7121><s%> that place <S%H4725><s%> Beersheba, <S%H884><s%> because they <S%H8147><s%> both swore there. <S%H7650><s%>

So they made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> at Beersheba. <S%H884><s%> Abimelech <S%H40><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> with Phicol, <S%H6369><s%> the captain <S%H8269><s%> of his army, <S%H6635><s%> and they returned <S%H7725><s%> into the land <S%H776><s%> of the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>

Abraham planted <S%H5193><s%> a tamarisk tree <S%H815><s%> in Beersheba, <S%H884><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> there on the name <S%H8034><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> the Everlasting <S%H5769><s%> God. <S%H410><s%>
Abraham <S%H85><s%> lived as a foreigner <S%H1481><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>
